title: Leaver Remake is unfair
body: I joined a game 1-2 minutes late due to some fault with my game. Quite often, the first game i play after opening the lol client results in my joining a game 1-2 minutes late. It is out of my control and i am no tech expert that knows how to fix it. As a result, i joined a game just too late and actually watched my nexus blow up due to the leaver remake. I also got five 20 minute time penalties and lost lp. This is absolutely ridiculous. The only reason why im being penalised 20 minutes is because of earlier offences where ive had similar issues where my game would crash or not open after champ select. I have never left a game on purpose or afked on purpose. I feel like im being penalised for something that is out of my control.

I never said i had a problem with the fact it was introduced that day and that i wasn't aware. I was simply justifying the reason why i tried playing my first game as a ranked knowing that i mightn't join the game until 2-3 mins in. My problem is the leaver remake itself.

I was pointing out that there was no reason to think it wouldn't be implemented around that time, assuming you had actually bothered to keep up to date with the happenings of the game.

As for the "issue" you've presented:

Based on what you've said, there is no issue with the remake system. The issue lies with how you chose to respond to an issue (an issue you were fully aware of, I might add) that was negatively impacting the game, for other players as well as you.

FACT: You have known about this issue for some time. You stated you've searched for a solution but have had no success, I'm curious if you've tried repairing the client, reinstalling and/or contacting support.

FACT: 1-2 minutes of loading time seems to be inaccurate, as you stated that "you joined the game to watch your nexus blow up" (witnessing the Remake taking place) which would only happen if you had spent 3+ minutes loading into the game.

FACT: By your own admission, this is not an uncommon issue. You know the circumstances it occurs under and, yet, do nothing to prevent it from influencing games. It would take all of 5 minutes each time you log on to ensure it has no impact on the experiences of you or anyone else.

FACT: 3 minutes is actually a significant amount of time to be AFK/DCed for, particularly in the early stages of any given match. Given it's a semi-regular occurrence, that's a lot of time you've spent AFK/DCed, and a lot of time where other players would have felt significantly disadvantaged in-game. In fact, it's more than reasonable to assume you've been picked up by the leavebuster system many times already.

FACT: While the circumstances may have been out of your control, your response to those circumstances created a negative experience for other players. You had the means to ensure the issue didn't impact the game and, yet, chose to do nothing, effectively breaking your agreements (TOU and EULA) with Riot.
This.

Bottom line kid. Your assumptions, statements and overall your conclusions are only based on your own preconceived ideas on this subject and you have falsely judged my situation and have included a myriad of false facts within your comment. Please get off if you have nothing positive to contribute.

> The 1-2 minutes was never an absolute exact number but an approximation that could fluctuate on different occasions.

I never said it was an exact number, just pointing out that it did seem inaccurate based on what *you* have stated. Seeing someone state "1-2 minutes" doesn't much indicate anything upwards of 3 minutes and, even if it did, it would be in a "it rarely happens, if ever" way.

> i actually said in another comment that i would not be joining any ranked games during my first game with this knowledge now.

That doesn't apply retroactively, though. Doesn't help the people who have already been impacted. Also, *just* for *ranked* games?

> So once again you are bloody incorrect in saying that i do nothing to prevent this from influencing other games.

Have you done anything *before* this point? Not that you've made us aware of. Like I said, it would take all of 5 minutes and the fact that this issue resulted in a *leavebuster punishment* most certainly indicates that you had done nothing until it became a "real" issue for *you*.

> Your point that it creates a negative experience for players is completely subjective and i don't agree with this either, when 1. My problem is a rare occurence and 2. Like i repeated earlier i would always join before 3 mins, or on most occasions within 1-2 minutes.

1. So, am I to assume you *lied* when you stated that "*Quite often*, the first game i play after opening the lol client results in my joining a game 1-2 minutes late." or are you lying now? It can't be *both* rare and quite often.
2. Saying "i would always join before 3 mins" contradict your earlier statement of "i joined a game just too late and actually watched my nexus blow up due to the leaver remake." so there's literally no reason to have said that. Saying that you would, on most occasions, join within 1-2 minutes is fair enough, however the accuracy of your "estimates" was never made clear until now.

> You should stop using this "negative experiences" as an argument, because it seems that the only person with a negative experience from an issue like this is you.

You assume that, because someone says nothing to *you*, that they don't take issue with how you've affected them. FACT: not everyone is going to spend their time explaining it to you. Just because they're quiet doesn't mean they've not been negatively impacted. You *can't* speak for them and, given the general attitude of the player-base, it's more than reasonable to assume that *many* people have been negatively impacted by this issue, even if they've not made that clear to *you personally*.

> Earlier you wrote that i had tried to solve the issue and by the end of your comment you're saing that i had been choosing to do nothing and creating a negative experience for players.

Attempting to solve the issue and preventing the issue from impacting games while searching for a solution are *two different things*. As far as solving the issue is concerned, you seem to have been doing what you can (though I'm not entirely sure how far you've actually gone with this). As far as preventing the issue from impacting games is concerned, there is more than enough to indicate that, up until it became a "real" issue for *you*, you had done nothing.

Bottom line, you got punished because you weren't taking responsibility for *how you responded to these circumstances*. You *had* the opportunity to minimise your impact but *failed to do so* until it got *you* punished.

The facts I included in my previous post were based around how the systems work, specific statements within the TOU and EULA and the "facts" you chose to share about your experiences taken as face value. If you find issue in those facts, it most likely lies in the "facts" you've chosen to share and/or the way you've chosen to share them.
